# Description of model

The model will be modified to have enzyme production as fraction of microbial biomass (not of uptake).
Enzyme will be produced to maintain a concentration outside the cells equal to a fixed fraction of micrbial biomass.

## Some parameter values from literature:

### Uptake

0.1 - 10 d^-1^ -> 0.004 - 0.4
Manzoni et al. 2016 -> Hobbie and Hobbie 2012

0.01 g C g^-1^ MBC h^-1^
Li et al. 2014 -> AWB model

### Microbial decay

0.00028 h^-1^
Allison et al. 2010, Li et al. 2014

0.022 d^-1^ -> 0.00092 h^-1^

### Microbial C minimum

mc_b0: Basal microbial carbon. Represents minimum (e.g. dormant) microbes. Does not decay, respire or produce enzymes, but adds to the microbial term in the MM-kinetics for uptake. 
0.00001 g C g^-1^ Soil
From Xu et al. 2013 (A global analysis of soil microbial biomass carbon). Lower valeus reported ca. 1mmol Cmic kg^-1^ Soil.
Also,compare to Guenet et al. 2011, 40 mg C kg^-1^ Soil = 0.00004 g C g^-1^ Soil in Versailles bare fallow.


### Enzyme decay

0.01 - 1 d^-1^
Manzoni et al. 2016 -> Allison 2006, Becerra et al. 2014

0.001 h^-1
Allison et al. 2010

0.05 d^-1^ -> 0.02 h^-1^
Schimel and Weintraub 2003

### Enzyme production

0.05 - 0.2 fraction of C_M
Schimel and Weintraub 2003 -> Umikalson et al., 1997; Romero et al., 1999; Tholudur et al., 1999

0.000005 h^-1^
Allison et al. 2010

0.0000056 h^-1^
Li et al. 2014 -> AWB model

0.01 of mic turnover, i.e. 0.01 * 0.00028 = 0.0000028
Li et al. 2014 -> MEND model


### V_D 
1 d^-1^
Schimel and Weintraub 2003


## Variables and constants added or changed with initial best guess.

mc_b0: 0.00001 g C g^-1^ Soil.Minimum microbial biomass.

f_de: 0.01. Fraction of microbial decay going to enzymes.

f_ue: 0.01. Fraction of uptake going to enzymes. Used only if flag_mic is off.

C_Em: Enzyme C at microbe surface.
